meanings.sent1: The strong blowing knocked over the umbrella.
meanings.sent2: I felt the blowing of the wind on my face.
meanings.sent3: The blowing from the fan made the papers fly around comically.
meanings.sent4: The blowing of the storm was like a fierce beast roaring outside.
meanings.sent5: The blowing of the wind sounded like a thousand whispers in the trees.

meanings.sent1: She was blowing bubbles in the park.
meanings.sent2: The musician was blowing into the trumpet.
meanings.sent3: The kids were blowing raspberries at each other playfully.
meanings.sent4: The whistle was blowing loudly, signaling the start of the game.
meanings.sent5: The wind blowing through the trees made a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: Causing something to move or be carried by air
meanings.sent1: The blowing leaves danced in the air.
meanings.sent2: The blowing curtains added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The blowing balloons made the room look festive.
meanings.sent4: Her blowing hair in the wind looked like a golden waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The blowing seeds were carried away by the breeze.

meanings.sent1: He regretted his blowing of the entire paycheck on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent2: The company's blowing of funds led to financial troubles.
meanings.sent3: Her blowing of the inheritance on luxury items shocked her family.
meanings.sent4: The blowing of resources on ineffective projects was a costly mistake.
meanings.sent5: The blowing of money on frivolous things left him with nothing for emergencies.
